For ten bucks, these are the richest sounding in the ear headphones I have ever owned.  I use these with my Google Pixel and the NT app which offers fantastic EQ.  Imaging, volume, and detailed reproduction of even the most delicate passages.

And. I am a clutz.  I have gotten in the car and drive for miles with these puppies dragging on the pavement.  They still work perfectly.  M French Bulldog has played with them, and I have slept on them, stepped on them, and had them out in the rain.  Takes a licking,
 and keeps on ticking.

Highly recommend.  While your are at it, buy a dozen.

author: Scribbler
title: Very impressed
content:
For years, I had been purchasing (and re-purchasing) the JLab Audio JBuds with microphone, which are guaranteed for life, but which always failed within 2-3 months. Sure, I could return them to get my money back, but the shipping is on me, and their warehouse needs to inspect them for defects. Reading between the lines, I felt certain their findings would be user error and tough luck for me.

So not expecting much, I purchased the Panasonic ear buds, and I just realized that I've been using the same pair for 8 months. I handle them the exact same way I'd handled the other brand, so Panasonic clearly makes better quality headphones. The buds fit comfortably in my ears and handle the twice-daily cord wrapping around my cell phone without causing internal damage to the wires. Jazz, classical, and rock music all sound fine (my aging eardrums are not the most discerning), but I mostly use the buds to listen to books during my commute. Love them, and will repurchase when needed.

UPDATE: Feb 2019. Almost 2 years later, these ear buds are still going strong. The only flaw is the rubber has started to separate at the connection port, exposing copper wire. But the sound is the same, so I have wrapped a bit of electrical tape around the plug, and we'll see how much longer I can make these last.

author: Seth R.
title: The Best of the best!!!!!
content:
These earphones are absolutely wonderful! I have about five pairs of them! I started with one and they lasted nearly a decade with heavy use and I am not over exaggerating! I bought a couple pairs for a friend and I am now using my second pair!

I have had this one pair for over a year now and I do video calls with my girlfriend for about 5 hours a day! I also listen to music as I work and take walks! They're built to last and I have not found one's with better sound quality anywhere!!! These are the earbuds!

It is definitely a five-star product and something that I am proud to stand behind! Thank you Panasonic!

author: Customer Advocate
title: Amazing. Better than any other wired, and many $49 and $64 earbuds/headphones...
content:
After much trial and error with many other higher priced earbuds/headphones, these Panasonic kick much butt!!! The fit is perfect and stays snug up to about 45 to 60 minutes of vigorous workouts. If not working out then the fit stays in perfect contact indefinitely. I've been using these for years.

Recently, I ventured out in search of some wireless earbuds/headphones ... and have been terribly disspointed so far.

Here's the scoop ...

Funcl True Wireless Earbuds ... Sound quality is horrible with very little audible bass. The only positive is that they seem to stay in the ear, which some "true wireless" fail to do. These Funcl True Wireless Earbuds are far inferior to the $19.99 LETSCOM Bluetooth Headphones IPX7 and $8.35 Panasonic ErgoFit In-Ear Earbud Headphones RP-HJE120-S (wired).

The Bliiq Bluetooth Headphones, HiFi Bass Stereo with Mic, [Hummingbird][Ambient Mode|SpinFit Earbuds] have better sound quality, but simply will not stay in the ear while working out or doing anything else.

Hopefully, this helps others not waste time.

I've been desperately seeking a high-quality pair of wireless earbuds, but so far I'm sticking with the Panasonic and LETSCOM (mentioned above) because they are much much better ... and cost a fraction of Bliiq and Funcl's wireless/Bluetooth. Why pay more for less?!

author: Mark Peterson
title: Quality has taken a nose dive since my last pair
content: I've ordered this same item about 4 times, they usually last for about a year or two and then either break or I lose them, week I'm totally fine with since they're usually inexpensive and good quality. When I ordered this pair, they were still inexpensive, but the quality had fallen off a cliff. It seems like Panasonic has either outsourced production to an inferior subcontractor or I received some kind of knock off. The largest, glaring problem is that the aux plug is too long. I compared it to my existing pair (which only has one working earbud, hence why I ordered the new pair), and the plug is a couple mm longer at least. This means that it can't lock in to my aux plug on my phone the way the old ones did, and it also means that there's a huge amount of static and interference whenever the plug is rotated at all. It makes it impossible to listen to anything. General build quality has taken a nosedive as well between my older pair and these, they don't seem nearly as solidly made. I wouldn't recommend these for anyone, at least until you can be sure you're getting the real deal and not the garbage I just returned.

author: fred calatayud
title: They lasted only 112 days.
content: We expected they would not last long - what did we think we were buying for only $12.88? So we purchased the Squaretrade insurance which, in theory, should provide for new replacements through 8/11/22. Trouble is, the Squaretrade site is so awful and challenging to use (I've already been locked out for entering an incorrect PW 5 times), with nonfunctional drop-down menus, etc. I'm just not sure we'll have the patience to go through this process 12 more times, which is what I'm banking on given the experience thus far. OK, crappy Panasonic earbuds - you win. Never again.

author: Gabriel Hymer
title: For the $, you can't find better sound
content: I just wanted a cheap pair of headphones, and after further review I won't be returning, because of the sound quality. It's impressive for these little guys. Theres bass, although not dynamic nor over-powering. The mids are punchy and the highs are clear - which doesn't disappoint, unless you want the club feeling of overwhelming. Again, the bass is nice, but not crazy. My cheap headphone bottom line has been raised to these. The only thing I'm worried about of course, is durability - how long will these last. The sound producing materials is fine, but the wires are pretty thin/cheap so I'll probably just keep these at work, because I'd prefer better quality on my commutes and office working at home, but I don't mind the black less attractive look for a few work things. For $ and sound I haven't found a better headphone. My next step up would be Betrons.

author: AndreD.
title: Loved them so much, I bought them a second time!
content:
Second time purchasing these as I lost my original ones. Extremely comfortable and come with multiple plug sizes so you can use the ones that fit the best. Awesome sound quality. I was actually very surprised with the lows/bass that the buds offer.

I also love/hate that they work effectively as ear plugs that block out ambient noise. Let me explain. I have a very loud muscle car and drive with the top off all the time. The sound of the car, the wind, and the other vehicles around me is very loud and drowns out the sound of other earphones unless I crank the volume waaaay up. Putting these buds in cancels out all that other noise so I can focus on the music and not have to blow my eardrums out in the process. That's a big LOVE right there. Unfortunately, if I wear them at the office to listen to my music while I work, I have a very difficult time hearing when someone is trying to get my attention, even with the volume turned down. So, great in one situation, but an inconvenience in another. It's a minor annoyance that does not take away the fact that these buds are fantastic considering how cheap the price is.

Get these buds and you'll be very pleased!

author: Brother J
title: Make sure you have an air-tight fit!
content:
After reading all the reviews, I ordered these and couldn't wait to hear the awesome sound, which would validate my thrifty nature!  (Read, cheap!)  When they arrived, I was really disappointed that they sounded so crappy.  Even though I was aware that an air-tight fit was really important, I assumed that my ears would be a "medium" size, so I used the medium silicone plugs.  I nearly returned them, but on a whim I tried the large size silicone plugs.  Wow, what a difference!  Suddenly my music came alive!  They really are amazing for under $10.

Pros:  Amazing bass.  Overall really good sound.  Super cheap.  They stay in my ears while running -- they don't even come close to falling out now that I am using the large sized silicone plugs.  Actually quite comfortable, even with the larger plugs.  So stupidly cheap, if they die -- whatever.

Cons:  Red is not red -- it is pink.  Whatever, I don't care.  Lots of "thudding" noises from running.  Oh well.  No volume controls.  Really, Panasonic?  Really?  What would that cost?  It might cost another $0.25, and I'd pay another $5.  Sounds like a win-win.  But again, whatever.

Summary:  I just bought another pair (in orange -- go Beavs!) just in case these die.  You should, too!

author: Simon
title: Non-existent warranty / Lack of support / Low-quality Product
content:
I've purchased these earbuds multiple times throughout this year because they've kept failing. I've purchased one this May and another this July, and when I got sick of repurchasing the item, I've attempted to contact Panasonic to have the item warrantied. When I called the Panasonic phone line that was listed on my order, I was informed that the wait time to reach a rep was around 20 minutes, and I might potentially be charged "$9.99" for the call. I hung up immediately and attempted the online support chat. Before the conversation even started, and before I said anything, I was told "this product has a 90 day warranty". Which leads me to believe Panasonic wants to discourage their users from attempting to warranty their items. I was told that in order to use the 90 day warranty, I will need to ship the item to one of their facilities, and I would need to pay for the shipping.

Panasonic appears to go out of their way to provide short window for warranties, and even when you qualify for the warranty, discourages you even further by having you shell-out for shipping, which basically amounts to the cost of a new product.

Needless to say, this will be the last time I purchase earbuds/earphones from Panasonic, and this will have bearing on my purchasing decisions in the future for all Panasonic products and services.

author: SuperMomHikerGirl
title: Good deal for the price; very basic; not for heavy or long time use I suspect.
content:
For the price, this is a good deal. While cheaply made with very thin cords and so on, the price is fantastic. The sound is fine for listening to the news on my laptop while not disturbing others or listening to my voice messages on my phone while maintaining privacy. Audiophiles will want something more sophisticated but will pay far more.

One thing I like about these is that the pin you plug in is at a 90-degree angle so that when I have my laptop on its side it doesn't stick straight out and I can scoot the laptop a little onto the base I keep it on so that the pin doesn't break off.

They come in a blister pack with some printed material and two extra sets of rubber ear pads--one set that is larger than the set that's installed and one set that is smaller than the installed set. There is no case or bag included.

I purchased this after the earbuds included with my S5 phone began to fail after 30 months, including times when I accidentally sat on them and pulled, probably pulling on the wires in the process. Plus, the plastic parts started to fall off. Because I wanted to take time to find the best set of earbuds or earphones to replace them without going overboard, I decided to buy these just so I could listen privately to things until I had time to research. I decide I could tuck them into a tiny zippered plastic bag and keep it in my bag for use listening to my phone when out and about and then keep the nicer pair I get after research at home.

The only reason I'm giving this a 3-star rating is that these are flimsy looking and I don't expect them to last a long time. For the price, they are perfectly adequate. This would be a decent set to give to a kid prone to losing things so they can keep them in their backpack.

author: Kram
title: Good price, but quality is lacking
content: This is my second pair of these earbuds and this set is not as durable as the first purchased. Two issues with these headphones. First, the wires connecting the earbuds and the power are very thin and not durable. In the first three weeks, a tug on the power end pulled the wiring loose. Still works, but I am anticipating failure soon. Second, the volume setting required to amplify the sound in the earbuds is much higher than my old set. This is in direct comparison to my previous set that is still functional. I realize they didn't cost much, but I expected this set to last and performance as well as my first purchase.

author: Apache Rose
title: A great set of ear buds for the price!
content:
Not much else to say. Simply designed, comfortable fit, and great sound. I have had an older pair made by Sony forever but I guess I didn't notice the loss of sound quality. Particularly, lower bass tones. With the new ones, those tones are very obvious...almost like I am hearing music for the first time. Also, the Panasonic Ergofit, when fitted properly, block out lots of exterior sound and you may even hear your heart. As such, if you are a high volume happy person, you may want to turn down the volume a bit. It just isn't necessary to blast these like I sometimes did with my older pair---granted, those are from days long gone when CD players were the main source of music. The fact that they lasted this long is great enough so if the new Panasonic last half as long, they are certainly the best money can buy at a fraction of the cost of higher end items.

Update: 9/22/16 Still love these and they are holding up with daily use. I can't lie. Sometimes I love avoiding people so not being able to hear anyone when I have these in is a secret pleasure. I suppose that could be a problem depending on when or where you wear them but I do not mind being alone with my thoughts and music. Absolutely worth the price!

author: The Zoo
title: Extremely Poor Quality My Last 2 Purchases
content: I've been ordering Panasonic headphones for years, and I've always been happy with them. They're usually comfortable, fit well, and last a decent amount of time for what you pay for them. However, my latest purchase was quite the opposite experience that I was expecting. I ordered a new pair as my old ones had finally kicked the bucket, the same exact pair as my old ones. This time, the part that plugs into the audio jack was crackling constantly and the audio would cut in and out when it was touched. The right earbud was also much quieter than the left. I sent them back and ordered a replacement of the same exact headphones, thinking my problems would be solved. Nope, they got even worse. Same exact problems with the replacement item, only now the right earbud won't even fit into my ear properly (I've never had problems with it before, and even got a relative to try it out, she also said it didn't fit correctly) while the left earbud stays in snug like it should. Extremely disappointed in the last two products. Not sure if it was a bad batch or what, but I won't be purchasing Panasonic headphones again.

author: Scott
title: The left ear completely went out in less than three months
content: Garbage. You get what you paid for though, I suppose.  I was hoping these would be the quality I had come to expect from previously owning a plasma TV from them for years and years.  Apparently their TV quality is the antithesis of their earbud quality.  Don't buy these.  I ignorantly bought two pairs when they were on a minor sale, and I regret it because I unknowingly supported such shoddy reliability.

author: Maria
title: Super Short Cord
content:
The cord on these is short, not 3.6' as claimed...maybe around 2.6'. I had to buy another pair for the office and just give these to my daughter, because they wouldn't even reach from my computer tower to my head, let alone with any extra room to move. That's what I get for buying them especially because they came in purple. The cuteness is kinda pointless when you can't use them. They'd be fine for use with your cell phone, but not for anything you're not holding or carrying in a jacket pocket.

I'm not a fake profile, nor have I been compensated for any reviews...in fact, the reason I take the time to review purchases when I can is due to the fact that I find other honest reviews helpful and am tired of all the fake reviews that have polluted this site. If you find my review helpful, please take the time to rate it as such, not because I'll get anything out of it but so that others can see true reviews. Thanks and Happy Shopping!

author: Steve Mont
title: Kinda misleading product photo
content:
These earbuds work great and have very acceptable audio quality considering their price, but I don't think I will be buying them again.

The main picture of the earbuds actually make it hard to tell but they are actually designed with the rubber insert off-center from the rest of the earbud, making them specific to right or left ear exclusively. This isn't that annoying in practice, but after about an hour of wear the plastic edge that sticks out and is supposed to rest outside of your ear-hole while the rubber nubbin thing goes in starts to really hurt. It's kind of like that weird pain you get on your ears when you wear a beanie for way too long. The really annoying thing about this is that it seems to be done as an added feature, like they produce two different buds, when in my experience earbuds that are both the same symetrical shape without the plastic bit sticking out work just as well and are way more comfortable. And it seems like they know this isn't even a particularly desired feature becuase the picture shows the only two angles that obscure this asymmetry: if they showed an angle from above it would be really clear, or even one from the side looking into the speaker hole would make it clear because the appendage where the cord attaches wouldnt be obscuring it. Maybe they chose this view because it has the logo on it, but one more angle would be helpful.

If you've tried earbuds that have this asymmetrical design, which rests hard plastic inside the valley of your ear instead of just being exclusively insertable rubber insulation, and have found them comfortable or secure or better for whatever reason then I would say these are great for the price. Personally in the future I'm going to look for the normal round ones, a preference I didn't even know I had before these guys.

author: Bobcat
title: They changed the design - what was once pretty good is now pretty bad
content:
They've changed the style of these. The previous style was fantastic. I tend to go through headphones due to a lot of abuse, but the sound was fantastic and had great bass and great at blocking out other noise. Ordered another set of 4 of these (again because I'm hard on headphones) and now the style has changed. Thinner wire, less base, doesn't block out noise as well.

I fail to understand why when people have a winning product that they feel the urge to redesign the product and make it worse. I guess it's to save money. Well they need to save their money because I'm certainly not spending any more of my money on these.

author: Der Adler des Mondes
title: Good deal, buy at your own risk.
content:
I'be bought two pairs and each was a hit and miss, the original pair was wonderful. The sound quality was magnificent and clear. The best headphones that was cost effective against higher quality headphones.

The only thing detracting this review is the piss poor quality of the second pair. The second pair came with its right headphone defective not to mention with the return policy I couldn't return the headphones so I was stuck with headphones that worked out of only one ear.

My advice is this, buy at your own risk but it is a good deal.

author: M.
title: I lose earbuds like it's my job
content:
(If you're wondering, it's because the cat thinks they're fabulous cat toys and can manage to find them no matter where I hide them, and I'm usually too lazy to move all my furniture when a replacement costs a few dollars. If and when I move out of my current apartment, I'll probably find a dozen pairs in the weirdest places.)

Because I'm so prone to "losing" them — [typed with heavy side-eye aimed in the cat's direction] — I tend to find the cheapest ones I can. I've got a more expensive Bluetooth set, but I'm terrible at remembering to charge them, so I like to have a corded pair handy and the last time I was shopping for earbuds, I opted for these. (Mental note: next time, get a bright pair even if the black ones are cheaper...easier to find.)

I point this out to make sure you understand my selection criteria: they have to be cheap. I don't need them to be attractive or have the best sound or whatever people normally try to find when they're shopping for earbuds. I mean, yes, I'd like them to work period, but for the most part I use them in bed to watch Golden Girls reruns on my phone. High quality is just a bonus.

And yet I'm still giving these four stars; for the price, they're absolutely fine. They get tangled worse than Christmas lights, but I've yet to find a pair that doesn't do that, so I can't really downgrade them for that. And no, they don't sound like a state-of-the-art stereo system. They haven't crapped out yet, though, and they're cheap enough that I can replace them if they eventually do.

author: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney
title: The first pair immediately broke and the second had a horrid microphone.
content: I ordered my first pair, and people I spoke to with the mic told me it was great.... and the jack end broke the very first time I removed them. No big deal, I can get a free replacement.... EXCEPT FOR THE FREE REPLACEMENT'S MICROPHONE IS SO STATICY IT HURTS MY FRIENDS' EARS. This product has *no* quality consistency. Buy at your own risk. You might get something good or garbage. I've had about 5 of these particular earbuds and the quality is never, ever the same. Sometimes they're near perfect, and sometimes, they break and have endless static.

author: Phoenix Omega
title: So far so good!
content: Ok, I've only used these once, so I can't comment on durability.  I can say that I have very small ears, and other earbuds HURT!!!!  My husband loves his earbuds, but to me they are torture devices.  I've always been jealous of the fact that he is able to use pocket-sized headphones, while I have to carry around big bulky over-ear ones.  I gave these a try because they come with small, medium, and large ear plugs.  I put on the small, of course, and for the first time I was able to use earbuds without pain!  There's still kind of a strangeness to having something in my ear, but they are comfortable enough that I am able to enjoy my music or audiobooks while running or walking.  I am not a sound geek at all, so I can't say how these compare to fancy-schmancy sound systems, but I listened to a playlist of old favorite songs, and they sounded as good as I remember them.  I listened to some of an audiobook and was able to hear every word clearly.  I am so happy to finally have pocket-sized headphones of my own that I could cry tears of joy!

author: William Kiely
title: Earbud broke off completely in less than 2 months
content:
This two-star review is for the pair of blue earbuds shown in the photo. I bought them for $14.97 on May 28th, 2017. Unfortunately the earbud broke completely off in just a month and a half (pictured).

I bought the green earbuds shown in the photo (this product: Panasonic ErgoFit In-Ear Earbud Headphones RP-HJE120-G (Green) Dynamic Crystal Clear Sound, Ergonomic Comfort-Fit) for just $5.98 over 18 months ago on January 5th, 2016. I have been using them almost every day and they still work great and I would recommend them.

The only issue is that the green earbuds don't have the microphone like the blue pair does. I bought the blue pair because I loved the green pair, but wanted a microphone. I wasn't any rougher on the blue pair than the green earbuds which are surviving for 18+ months. Looking closely I can see that the earbuds weren't made in the same way (or apparently with the same quality.) Unfortunate. Wish I could replicate the green pair, but add a microphone.

author: Andy
title: Holding Up Well after 11 months
content: I purchased these for myself about 11 months ago.  My primary use for these is either listening to music or talks when I am out doing a multi-mile walk or sometimes when I am sitting in a lobby waiting for my son to come out of a session with a therapist where I am not needed back there. I keep them in an old Altoids case when I'm not using them to protect the wires.  One of the things I really like about these is that they stay well in my ears during walking.  The previous two pairs I had been using, which came from local stores, kept slipping a bit out of my ears as I would walk.  I generally walk around 4-4.5 miles an hour when I'm out walking, so I think they'd also stay in well for a light paced jog. I don't know how they'd do for running. When I first got these, I was able to go out walking about 5 days a week.  My current schedule has become more complicated and I have to do more HIIT at home after my weights, which is a bummer, because I'm a lot more mellow when I get to go on a longer walk, it has mood magic for me that HIIT totally doesn't, but  I do still get to use them occasionally for that.  So in the first few months, heavy use for at least an hour a day.  Now, more irregular use, but still holding up well.

author: Daniel Newcombe
title: Sounds good. Hopefully not fragile.
content:
Have only had them for a day but love them.  They sound a lot better than the ones they replaced. They fit in my ears well and don’t fall out while jogging.  While no active noise cancelling, they fit so well that most outside noise doesn’t get through.  My wife was apparently taking to me and I didn’t notice.
No volume control.
Only concern is how thin the wire to the actual earpieces are.  I will have to be careful taking them out and not using the cord to pop them out.  Will see if they hold up.

author: Emi A
title: Reasonable, lightweight earphones
content: This is probably the 7th pair of these Panasonic earbuds that I’ve owned and – despite their lifetime being shorter than I’d like – I keep getting more because they work so well for the price. The sound quality out of these tiny earbuds is outstanding! Everything comes through with perfect clarity and depth – it all sounds pristine. My favorite part is the included microphone, which is works perfectly for hands-free phone calls. This time I got the gorgeous metallic violet color. As usual, the earbuds came packaged with three different silicone earpads for fit. I stuck with the default medium ones. I am able to fit these in my ears without them falling out, unless I’m sweating it out at the gym. After using them for a few weeks, the sound through them is perfect bliss. However, I’ve had multiple pairs of these headphones fail after around 3-6 months of use. One of the earbuds will inevitably become fainter than the other, or quit producing sound entirely. It’s a shame they fail so quickly – I would expect them to have a longer lifespan, more like a year. Nonetheless, for the price, you get some great quality earbuds (with a microphone!!).

author: John Jay
title: $5.50 or $105.50 these sound awesome!
content:
I have quite a collection of headsets both earbuds and over the ear full sized cans from inexpensive skull candy to higher end Shure in ear monitors, Bose over ear and V-Moda Crossfade M100s and these little baby's hold their own against them all. Surprising bass and decent separation and I got a green pair for like $5.50 or some crazy low price. Unbelievable! If for nothing else grab a set just to throw in the consol of your car for emergencies.

Update: so my Shure IEM's finally failed on me. I lost the left channel so I started using these as my go to buds and I'm still blown away with their stellar sound. I feel no need to replace my high end earbuds because these do the job very nicely. One thing I've noticed now that I use them daily for hours on end is they fit very comfortably, more so than any other earbuds I've used in the past and they stay put very well, again, better than any other earbuds I've used. You simply can't go wrong with a set of these. I'm buying up a few more sets as backup and to give out to friends and family.

author: Andrew B
title: Used to be great - now they're worse than garbage
content:
I used to swear by this line of earbuds as a reasonably high-quality but affordable set of ear buds. Unfortunately I damaged my last pair, so I of course decided to reorder these based on my great prior experience. To my dismay the pair I received can only be described as worse than garbage. No, I'm not even sure that's a fair description because it doesn't do justice to the garbage headphones out there. Imagine that the music you love was first sent through a massive body of water for some good ol' distortion. After your music managed to cross the ocean, it was then transported childhood-style through a "tin can telephone" for refinement. Once/if the music had managed to survive that you get the privilege of listening to the songs you enjoyed being butchered.

Want a better way to listen to music? Find a $0.99 bluetooth speaker from the depths of your local dumpster and give it a try. I'm sure it would surpass the quality of these headphones by a wide margin.

With partial joking aside, I'm just disappointed that an affordable series of headphones has declined so significantly in quality from when I last purchased them. I purchased two of these, so the odds of it being just a defective unit are slim. Rather, I think the quality of the product has been compromised.

author: makaiguy
title: A gem of a low priced earbud.
content:
I'm apparently hard on earbuds used with my Clip Zip MP3 player.  The tiny wires end up becoming nonfunctional for me after a few months of use, causing me replace them on a regular basis.  Like everyone else, I want to get good bang for my buck, but most of the inexpensive earbuds I've tried just don't sound all that good.  I had pretty much settled on Griffin EarThump earbuds as having pretty darned good sound in the less-than-ten-bucks arena, but Griffin has gotten out of the earbud business, so I had to find a new supplier.  (You can still find some sellers with remaining stock, but the writing is on the wall...)

Based on reviews here, I decided to order a pair of Panasonic ErgoFit buds to try.  After a month or so of use, I have to say I am really impressed.  I thought the Griffins were pretty good, but the sound of these Panasonics blow the Griffins out of the water.  Nobody is going to confuse these with expensive over-the-ear earphones, but for casual use they sound terrific.

With any of these earbuds, proper fit is essential.  Their small drivers rely on you getting a good seal when you insert the buds in your ears.  With a good seal, you get good low frequency performance; without a good seal, you lose the low frequencies and everything sounds tinny.  Most come with several sizes of interchangeable ear pads.  It's important to experiment to find the pads that fit your ears best.  The shape of the tube over which the pads fit on the Panasonics is oval, which gives a slightly oval shape to the pads, and this seems to fit my ears very well (with the larger pads).  I use the MP3 player when mowing, and with the Panasonics, I don't have to shove the buds as firmly into my ears as I used to to block out the mower noise.

[Added June 2018]  Here it is almost two years later, and I'm still using this same pair of earbuds.  Never have I had a pair last anywhere near this long.  I've just ordered a pair for my wife, who has been going through my old cheapies that came with various devices like water, plus a couple more for backups.

author: CorriePritzell
title: Mic Sounds Good / Audio Sounds Good / Right-Angled Jack is Ideal for Smart Phones
content:
Great microphone, great audio, and right-angle jack makes phone more pocket-friendly.

I have bought sooo many (official/approved) Apple EarPods, and they all break. Mostly because when I put my phone in my front pocket and then sit down, the cable juts out from the phone in a straight line, and eventually it wears out, so that signal starts cutting out to one of the ears, or the microphone fails.

And I've tried to buy knock-offs, and those sound terrible, or their mics are awful.

Today, I received this Panasonic ErgoFit. I've tested the sound and the microphone. Both are excellent (for this price). And, best of all, the right-angled jack means that now my phone will sit easier in my pocket, and the cable will be less likely to get damaged.

I'm hoping these last a long time.

If you're looking for an affordable set of ear-buds that sound good, have a good microphone for calls/dictation, and a right-angle jack, I heartily recommend this.  And I'm someone who *rarely* writes reviews.

_______

UPDATE !
I love these earbuds so much, I keep buying them when I lose my last pair.  I forgot I wrote this review, then I wrote another review, but amazon wouldn't let me post it because this review already exists. Anyhow, this is what I wrote today May 21st 2019 :
_________
I used to think Apple Earbuds were the best until I tried these. These sound incredible, and the microphone sounds great to whoever is calling you. The rubber fittings on the earbuds feel great and block out just the right amount of ambient noise. They're so comfortable.

I'm a professional musician & producer, and I've been so disgusted by other earbuds terrible speakers -- often way too sibilant, or distorted.  I fear they inflict ear damage.  Not these. These sound well balanced across the EQ spectrum.

My only complaint is with myself : I keep losing earbuds. I've literally bought these 4 times.  For Christmas and birthdays sometimes family gives me earbuds, but those always sound terrible, and I keep coming back to this pair. For example, my mom bought me Apple Earbuds for Christmas, assuming I'd prefer them. But then I did a test. I called her from the other side of the house, and I switched the earbuds back and forth between the Panasonic and the Apple, and asked her which one sounded better when I was speaking through the microphone.  She chose these ones!  Even though they're much more affordable!  She was shocked.

I'm not loyal to any brands, but, wow, Panasonic really got this one right. THANK YOU.  Seriously, the market is flooded with terrible sounding earbuds, and it's really hard to find one that:
- Earbuds sound great
- Microphone sounds great
- Comfortable
- Affordable

I give these my highest recommendation.
Enjoy!

author: V-Len
title: Meh. Let's see if they last.
content:
I bought these based on the great reviews here but they really sound like average 8 dollar earbuds. In fact, when using them on my laptop I could hardly hear anything so I switched to a cheap sports ear buds (they are called ihip warrior) and these were a lot louder. The last pair of earbuds I had were from a drug store. The sound quality was average but they lasted over a year including falls and snags. If the panasonics break in less than a year I'll update the review.
One more thing, the cord for the Panasonic earbuds came really bunched up and tangled and the packaging was the kind I have to use scissors and pry open which is a real hassle for some cheap earbuds.

Edit: These earbuds lasted for more than a year with average use. They only broke after I fell asleep on them. I was going to buy them again but I see Amazon has raised the price to $10 (and pretending that is a sales price from $15). I originally paid $8.87 for these and that all they are worth to me.

author: Ciambella
title: My Lamentable Love Stories with Earbuds
content:
Spouse often says I'm rough on earphones. I'm certain that I've never beat up any of them, nor have I scolded them for anything they did or did not do. In fact, when it comes to earphones, I've always acted like a dotting parent or sometimes, smitten admirer. I've always started off loving them to bits and they loved me right back for a while, then they grew up (headphone years are like dog years, you blink once and it's terrible twos, blink twice and it's rebellious teens, so the honeymoon usually did not last very long) and became obnoxious things. I have tolerated a lot of bad behaviours, but when they let the precious connection between the ear buds and the cord fraying away (and they always do), I have to put my foot down. Time to open the wallet once more.

I can't count how many pairs of earphones have passed through my life that way. All with pedigree or well-known parentage -- Apple, Sony, Panasonic, Skullcandy, Dre, Plantronics, Koss, Philips, JVC, Pioneer, etc -- and all came and went without leaving a lasting impression in my memory. Except my precious Bose QC, but they fit over the ears so they don't belong in this lamentable tale.

Enter this pair of Panasonic ErgoFit. Not the first pair of Panasonic earphones I've owned. Today is still a couple of days short of 6 weeks since ErgoFit and I became partners. We are constantly with each other and with beauty music flowing between us -- Agustín Barrios, Joaquín Rodrigo, Émile Waldteufel, Buster Smith, Toots Thielesman, Laurindo Almeida, etc. Chuck Prophet sometimes drops in and that's fun too. We also enjoy Cornelius Garrett, Michael Drew, Sian Phillips, Clifford Norgate and many others giving their voices to Georgette Heyer novels, over and over and over again.

As mentioned above, it's not quite six weeks yet so my new relationship is still rosy. If I don't come back to alter this rating of 4-star in a few months, then it means I've found true love with Panasonic ErgoFit. Wish us luck.

Edit: My faithful ErgoFit earphones were chewed up by a curious Bichon Frise named Bear during Thanksgiving week when we visited his owners, my husband's sister and her husband. Immediately after we returned home, I placed another order, and this second ErgoFit pair works just as beautifully as the first, thank you Panasonic.

author: Decibolic
title: Best in-ears under $99 that I have used
content:
I am seriously impressed with the sound quality of these. I have tried a few name brand and off brand in ears. Aside from a professional set of $99 single driver IEMs I own nothing else’s has come close to what these produce.
I have owned this set for over a year, and they receive near nightly use (for music and video listening as I go to sleep to not disturb my wife).
Every set compared has been with high sample rate (48k/24bit) media both flat and with adjusting EQ.
Having that said, the Panasonic earbuds sound like they have had an EQ curve pre-set. Which is fine as they cut and enhance all the right frequencies.
What I can’t believe is how inexpensive these are. I bought them as throw-away but they have become a favorite listening set. The next closest under $100 are a limited run artist endorsed set given to me by the manufacturer valued at $70.

author: Vonzo
title: Excellent deal.  Perfect for sitting at a PC and listening to radio or songs on the web.  5 stars because that's why I bought em
content:
For the cost these are great.  I'm only using them while sitting at my desk.  They've been in for two hours and are hardly noticeable. I wouldn't use these for running.  The cord, when it hits my chest, send a thump thump sound into my ears.  That's always a problem for me with these ear buds that have the silicone things on them.  Not sure if that's just me or everybody.

I tested some different music and they all sounded great at a reasonable volume.  By reasonable I mean I can comfortably listen to it at that level for hours and I'm not over driving the speakers at all.  It's also not too quiet where I have to focus to hear the music.  Here's what i tested and again, it all sounded great to me.  Good bass, mids and treble.  Bass was clear not fuzzy and treble was good, not tin can sounding.
Songs on YouTube
Too $hort: Gettin it
Tupac: All Eyez On Me
Daddy Yankee: Shaky Shaky
Metallica: Motorbreath
White Zombie: Thunder Kiss '65
Enya: Boadicea
Pachelbel: Canon in D
Also,
Talk Radio over the internet.

author: Thomas
title: The greatest earbuds you'll find for the price
content: Why are these the greatest earbuds? I don't know why you would ever bother buying any from the store when these surpass any other earbuds I've ever had and still cost less than many of the cheap no-name brands they sell in the stores. The have great range and seem to last much longer than any of the other ones as well. I've bought many different kinds of cheap earbuds and they always seem to stop working and just plain fall apart, but not these. I've actually bought several pair of these over the years and they weren't being replaced because they stopped working, usually it was because they got lost. I've even washed and dried these in the dryer and they still worked fine. You may be able to spend alot more money and buy something better, but for the price, you want find better than these.

author: cdkee
title: Great quality, reliable, and cheap.
content:
Over the years I've owned many pairs of earbuds, expensive, inexpensive, and over the spectrum of brands.

They have all consistently either broken or degraded after time has passed.  Some have annoying cables that make noise in your ears when they rub against clothing, some have cables that break or become frayed, and some become tangled incessantly.

The Panasonic HJE-120s have never let me down. For the price, the audio quality is great and the physical quality of the pair is also great.  They're cheap enough where I throw them in my pocket, or my bag and don't really care if something happens to them. However, they've never broken on me or made me disappointed.

I like them so much that I probably have 4 pairs, and have bought more for members of my family. I personally have a pair at my desk at work, in my car, at my house, and in my bag.

I'd recommend them without hesitation.

author: D Jones
title: Amazing sound, poor bulid quality
content:
These stopped working in less than 4 weeks. I lightly used them, and the sound started to cut out and crackle. I contacted Panasonic, and they gave me a full refund without hassle, which I appreciate.

These earbuds are interesting. On the one hand, the build quality and design leaves a lot to be desired, on the other, the sound quality is amazing. I tested these across a range of music and audio listening devices, and the sound was consistently great. The bass was deep and rich with a warmth that most earbuds in the sub-$50 range lack. The mids and highs came through crystal clear but never piercing. Even at high volumes, it never gave me a headache like cheaper headphones tend to. I was genuinely impressed with how amazing these sounded.

Unfortunately, the build quality feels cheap, and after minimal use, these began to cut out and stopped working. It was disappointing because I really loved listening to these. Fortunately, as mentioned above, Panasonic gave me a full refund, but I would rather have them still working.

author: Roy S. Oppenheimer
title: Customers pay shipping for return to Panasonic when time runs out on Amazons return.
content: I've had good luck in the past with these earbuds. Overall I bought about 6 pairs. They are very inexpensive and have worked fine in the past. I bought them for the wife and kids and a few for me over the past few years. However I think the quality is going down hill. This last pair I bought lasted only a few months and now any movement of the wire causes the earbuds to go out. If you contact Panasonic they will tell you to send them back to be serviced. Problem with that is the cost of shipping is on the customer and you may as well just buy a new pair for the price. They won't just send a replacement. This last pair of earbuds never even left the house. They were only used at night when I watched programs on my tablet in bed so I wouldn't keep my wife awake. Minimum use at best and they didn't hold up long.  I am curious to hear if others are starting to notice a downward trend with the quality of these earbuds or was it just a fluke.

author: Sean L.
title: Solid Purchase on a Budget
content:
They sound amazing for their super cheap price, but I have big ears and even with the biggest tips they don't stay in when I'm active.

I purchased these to replace some no longer made JVC earbuds that did work well for when I was bicycling, hiking, fishing, out and active, at work, traveling, etc.

These came highly recommended for a tight budget, and the sound they make is great.

But seeing that the JVC's I used to buy were constantly only $4-5 more at most when I purchased them there's a few issue with these that hold back one star.

The fitment while good doesn't hold...at least in my ears, no matter the bud size provided. Might try some marshmallow buds later.

The cable is easily to tangle and has no split secure slider. Makes it a pain to keep these wrapped up and easily unwrapped between uses. I spend more time untangling these than I should need to.

With that said, they sound absolutely GREAT for the money, plenty of bass, clear mids and crisp treble. They might even sound better than the Carbon Nanotube gimmick the JVC's flaunted, and I really do enjoy listening to them, from my phone, MP3 player, laptop(s), etc.

Overall happy with them! Even with my gripes, these have easily earned the 4-star rating after a Summer's worth of use they're holding up well, and even with all the tangles I've had they're still in great shape and no major cable memory issues. They are light weight and super cheap so I'm less afraid of damaging them too. For the money, these are a solid purchase!

author: Mike
title: There is a reason these earbuds have 58 thousand reviews
content: These are the best $10 earbuds I have ever seen.  Lots of people buy them because they are great.  I got two, one for my wife and one for myself.  We use them on our cell phones.  The sound quality is major big improvement over the phone microphone and speaker.  You can answer the phone with them plugged in using the answer button on your phone.  You also use the phone volume buttons for volume control.  Good sound, good quality, person on other end of calls says microphone sound is great.  Highly recommended.

author: Turtul
title: Best Earbuds I've Found! WOW. Make Sure You Push Them In For Best Fit!
content:
Okay this is my first time leaving feedback on an item, but I'm just so amazed that I have to take the time to do so. To preface, I was super duper skeptical about the reviews on these little cheapy pair of earbuds being worth all the positive reviews and praise. So really, I bought them for that reason because I normally HATE earbuds and prefer regular headphones. Now I understand the hype! This is what I have always wanted earbuds to sound like, honestly.

I have never, not once, found a pair of earbuds that met ALL of the following criteria:
- fit snuggly
- fit comfortably (I have only had these in a short while, but plan to put them through a couple hours of use to see if they hold up and don't hurt my ears)
- didn't fall out during exercise/jumping around/just shaking my head (I was convinced my ears were just shaped weird and not meant for earbuds)
- sounded comparable to a pair of regular, on-ear headphones (in MY opinion, as I'm no audiophile and only know what I personally like to hear)
- had noticeable bass despite being EAR BUDS!

About that last point -- if they still sound "tinny" or lack bass to you guys who have purchased them, try pushing them further into your ear or switching out the in-ear pieces to a different size. I initially just "placed" the buds in my ears, turned on the music, and was disappointed. They sounded the same as my Apple earbuds! It wasn't until I actually did as another commenter said to do and PUSHED THEM IN. Kind of like you would with ear plugs! If you're like me, you'll notice quite a difference in sound quality doing that. It cancels out all outside noise completely when the music is playing which is insanely awesome for what were only $9 earbuds!

I'm amazed and impressed and actually can't wait to exercise with these in, haha. And that right there is reason enough for me to give these five stars, so now I just hope they keep performing well and don't hurt my ears longterm, which is my only concern and something time will tell! I may just buy an extra pair for the future just in case these stop being produced or something lol. Awesome product and worth trying for the price!

author: BcKc
title: Product arrived defective, no return allowed
content:
I've purchased these headphones three times, always have solid sound quality and fit comfortably in my ears. However, was very disappointed this product arrived damaged in the packaging (plastic wire covering defective, leaving part of the wires exposed). Would have just filed a return but received an error saying this product cannot be returned. Super frustrating that I'm now stuck with a defective product and no way to get my money back.
*****
Update, I checked further and sent a "get product support" message to see if there's an alternative way to get the product returned. Filled out a quick message, the next page simply includes the manufacturing contact info (1-800 support number) and a link to Panasonic's own website. Amazon's own link for "more assistance" at the bottom of the page is broken and just shows some code for a relative link, totally unusable. Just know if you get a defective item you're stuck!

author: warren krettek
title: They've worked like a charm
content:
I purchased these headphones approximately 1 1/2 years ago and they still work. When I originally bought them I needed them as all-purpose headphones which I could bring to school, use in the weight room, and use while doing work around the house. For a large portion of the time I've had them that's exactly what I've used them for, and they've worked like a charm. It is important to note, however, that these headphones are all-plastic, so they will take some abuse but will get damaged if the situation gets too rough. (I'll touch on that a bit more later).

For the price, the sound quality of these in-ears is fantastic. When I let a friend use them once, he immediately responded with "whoa." For $10 earbuds the sound is very impressive and probably suitable for most people. These headphones have a balanced sound with enough clarity to deliver the basic framework of whatever music you're listening to, plus a little bit more. If you're mostly a passive listener and want cheap earbuds you won't have to worry about if they get lost or stolen, these are a great buy.

When I eventually upgraded to more expensive earbuds, these ones were able still to hold a candle to the competition, although with further comparison the Panasonic's are slightly "blattier" and "fuzzier" than higher-quality, more expensive options. On their own, though, these earbuds sound significantly better than others in their price range, even rivaling some costing around $25.

I used these earbuds as my primary listening medium for about nine months and they withstood a lot of abuse. Every day I would take them to school, usually stuffing them in the smaller pocket of my backpack and carrying them wherever I went. For a long time, they stood strong. However,  I pulled the buds out of my ears one day and the right side wasn't all together. In fact, the right speaker had split off from the rest of the earbud's housing. However, the wire to the speaker was still intact and after I gently snapped the two pieces back together, both earbuds worked just the same. Unfortunately, I was long passed the ninety (90) day warranty for the headphones and there was nothing I could do to have them fixed. From then on, I have had to be careful when pulling the right bud from my ear, but besides that, nothing else has broken.

Now, these earbuds have long been replaced by more expensive ones with higher sound quality. Currently, I use them as my main running earbuds:  these headphones are good enough to get me in the groove, but I wouldn't be too upset if they broke. So far, they have managed fairly well despite their earlier injuries and despite being sweated on a great deal. They still work just fine and sound exactly how they did when I first got them.

Pros:

-Cheap
-Sound GREAT for the price
-Reasonably durable
-Ergo fit (fits very well in your ears & helps you figure out which side is which)

Cons:

-90 day warranty
-Plastic housing
-Thin shielding on the main cord

The Panasonic's also come with a mic and a pause/play button on the cord. It's also important to mention that these headphones are in-ears and fit pretty snugly in your ear, which I think helps block out sound and helps to keep the bud in place. For some people this could be uncomfortable and be a big negative for them.

Overall, the Panasonic RPTCM125's are great-sounding headphones for the price, which you can take around with you almost anywhere. They will withstand a lot of abuse but, sadly, are only covered under warranty for the first three months. Recommended for the listener who wants a pair of powerful headphones for cheap.

Update 7/10/2015:
Changed my rating to better match my experience with the product.

author: Lynn Dion
title: Unbelievably excellent buds, but believe it anyway
content:
Get a bunch -at this price - throw them into the bottom of every bag you own so you always have a pair of excellent non-slip buds for all devices.  Sound is excellent, more bass resonance than there is any reason to expect (I tested them on the filmscore suite to "Blood Diamond." Pull it up on YouTube if you haven't heard it -- all amazing African percussion),  The best part is that the little hard straight bit that extends directly out from the bud itself like a stick is quite short, so it fits smoothly, without pinching or pressing the earlobe, under a heavy-duty sound killer headset designed for using on a firing range or heavy construction -- I'm not a shooter, but I am a writer in New York City, and there are times when an artillery range would be preferable.  With the sound killers, these little buds put you on your own planet -- I can't say enough good about them.  The 3-size selection of bud caps to custom fit to your ear is a brilliant touch.
The bubble package is a complete pain in the ass to get into -- be careful you don't have the little spare bud caps fly across the room when you finally wrangle it open.  Other than that, they are fabulous.

author: David
title: I thought they were pretty good, but these are better
content:
For years, I've been using a pair of Samsung buds that came with my S3. I thought they were pretty good, but these are better.

The sound quality is very good. My laptop has always had a very pronounced hiss over my S3 headphones. With these, the hiss is much less pronounced. Obviously they won't be able to duplicate bass the way larger speakers can, but because they seal the ear canal they actually do a pretty good job with the bass, producing a very nice and even sound.

Comfort is also very good. They come with three different sizes of rubber cushions, and the shape of the earbuds very nice. It's lower profile than my Samsungs and it also conforms more to the shape of the ear, helping to keep them from falling out.

The way they seal the ear canal also provides a little attenuation of background noise. You couldn't use them as ear protection when shooting a gun or anything like that, but they help a little with background noise and such.

All in all, very happy customer.

author: William Sullivan
title: Definitely consider these
content:
I've purchased many pair of these.

Pros:  Excellent sound quality for the money (I don't use a lot of bass).
Stay in my ears (many/most buds fall out. I have very small ear openings.
Inexpensive.  Not a big deal if lost or damaged.

Cons:  and this is the reason for only 3 stars.  The microphone is too sensitive.  When I've used these with the phone and there is almost any ambient noise, the person on the other end of the line picks up every sound and I get frequent complaints that they cannot understand me due to the loud background noise.  They find it very irritating.
Doesn't have volume control...but what do you expect for around $10-12.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Going running
content: I can't believe these are so cheap! These sound fantastic. I mean I can feel myself getting fitter and more productive already. I put on a "running" song to try out the quality and I immediately wanted to go running. I don't really run. At least I haven't in a while. I think I'll go now. Or maybe I'll clean the house...something that involves moving. I got purple cause every color is a slightly different price and they were one of the cheapest. I actually ended up liking the color. It comes with 3 different size rubber tips to fit your size ears.

author: Aaron
title: Bought a 2nd pair just in case
content:
I bought my first set of the panasonic earbuds (with microphone) in October 2018.  Since then, I've bought the same thing for my wife, and another one for me, just in case my first set ever goes out.  In Zoom/Slack conference calls (not phone calls), I often get compliments on how well my voice comes through and when I switch from my phone's built-in mic to the Panasonic headset I've been told "wow, that's a lot better, you could be a podcaster now".

I really like the low price, nice fit, and high quality mic.  The headphones are very usable, but for the price point, don't expect thumping base or even frequency response across the whole spectrum.  These are not for the audiophile, but they are amazing for a road warrior, for phone calls, and for casual use as headphones.

author: Victoria P
title: Edit : Let me take you back!
content:
These earbuds really have so many awesome things about them. I've used them for about 2 years and have purchased three pairs within the time span. The sound quality is great, and I love the shape of the ear bud - you don't have to squish it in your ear, it just glides right through! Also, while being comfortable, they don't fall out easily, and they also aren't bad for working out from my experience. Aside from that, they have also lasted me for quite a bit, the longest being 8 months.
My complaint is that out of the blue, my earbuds are having this horribly loud static noise coming from the left ear after putting them in. I've had these for 8 months, so I'm shocked they kept up so long, but normally when my earbuds start "dying", one of the buds does not have any sound. I would have taken that over the horrible static. It was so loud you could feel it, and my ears are a little sensitive, so it was extra unpleasant. So that's the big reason for the 4 stars, but also because I feel that they could improve on the audio jack shape (if that's what it's even called?) for the cable. It's a bended L shape for these earbuds, and they may not suite some phone cases. I recently changed cases, and the only way it would fit was by me positioning it a certain way. It was bothersome having to keep it that way, because I move around a lot and like to keep my phone in my pocket while I clean or exercise. Suddenly, my music stops since I moved a bit, and I keep having to repostion it. My new phone case probably wasn't designed for this type of cable shape in the first place, but I feel that if they stuck with just a long, non bended shape, it could be better suited for all cases. If they won't change it, it would be nice for them to add a photo of that to show the buyers the shape of the cord so they know what they are getting.
I suggest buying 2 pairs after you try them for the first time and getting one of those two year warranty things. That way, you can still have one pair to listen on while the other is being repaired (this option is for the die hard music lovers like me who need it everyday and night!). Now I'm switching over to another brand that may suit my phone case and my preferences, but I definitely recommend these. I'll probably come back if I'm not satisfied with my next pair.

EDIT: Hands down best earbuds you'll get on Amazon. My last pair lasted 8 months, much longer than others I've had. Other earbuds here that are at a decent price don't sound as great as these. I tried moving onto another brand, but they were about the same price, and they were horrible! I'll take Panasonic back, so sorry for ever switching. Now and forever my go to for earbuds. Also, the audiojack fits perfectly with the case, I'm assuming they changed something, at least for the earbuds with the mic. Love Panasonic, never leaving again!

author: SOFLOFAM
title: Terrible sound.
content: I figured with so many reviews and such a high rating that I would be pleasantly surprised, alas...no.  The sound quality is just terrible. Even considering the price point, the sound is just awful. I think I could have found something better at one of those stores where everything is just a buck. I wasn't even using these to listen to music, I was using them to listen to an audiobook without disrupting my husband. I would not recommend.

author: AmazonCustomer
title: Good budget option
content:
I don't think you can beat these for durability for the price.  I wear these for 3-5 hours a day for commuting and workouts.  The first pair lasted 8 months before the right channel started cutting in and out.  This is from the tip wearing out over time which is expected. Other models in this price range would fail under heavy use as soon as a few weeks and certainly within 3 months.

The sound quality is nothing to get excited about.  When they are fit properly in your ears the sound is VERY mid-range heavy almost like an old AM radio and they also suppress external sound.  I have no idea what the  Wirecutter is talking about in their review by the way.  For apps with EQ I cut the mids and boost the bass and treble to clear up the sound.  Apps that don't have EQ are muddy and unlistenable.  The noise suppression caused cramming an expanding earpice in your ear is disconcerting for phone calls.  I find I can't hear my own voice and have to take the left earpiece out to hear myself.

Still for the price, this is a solid option.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Defective Earbud
content: When I initially bought a pair of these in 2016, I loved them. They were 5 star quality compared to more expensive headphones that I previously purchased. I am a runner so I constantly run into (no pun intended) the issue of sweat seeping into my earbuds and causing them to die out. That was not the case with this pair of headphones so I thought that I was in a good place. After everyday use for about 10 months, one of the earbuds went out. Considering their price, I thought that was great! I had no problem purchasing another pair. Because I loved them so much, I purchased 2 pairs this time. One for use now and the other for use after these eventually blew out. I bought these two back in May of 2017. The first pair of the May purchase just blew out last weekend. BUMMER, but that is what the second pair was for! My only issue is that once I opened the second box (of the May 2017 order) and placed the earbuds in my ears, no sound was coming out of the right earbud. I am super irritated. It would have been different if they died out after at least a couple of months, but these babies were defective right out of the box! I don't know if this is an anomaly or what, but I am bummed.

author: Jason Four
title: I've made a mistake of not reading the most recent reviews.
content:
One star, because earbuds are mislabeled. When I first saw, that mic was on the left side, I thought how odd! Then noticed music sounded reversed. Ran a test, and sure enough, earbud labeled "L" produces RIGHT channel sound!
 Luckily (or by design) they fit in ear when reversed, so I just put Left earbud in Right ear, and vice versa.
 Sound quality is poor, microphone is even worse than OEM S7 Samsung earbuds, and overall materials quality is low. But I suppose I shouldn't expect a good product for $10.

author: Phil
title: If you get a defective pair, don't expect any customer service help and say goodbye to your money
content:
I purchased a pair of these earphones in December 2017 due to the overwhelming number of positive reviews. When they first arrived I was so happy with the sound quality, comfort level in-ear, and their ability to block outside noise. I use my headphones for schoolwork or to watch movies on my computer; I am by no means rough with them, I store them carefully, I'd had my last pair for 8 years, etc. However, only one month after purchase, the left earphone suddenly shorted out and ceased working. I attempted to return them through Amazon and was instead told to contact Panasonic directly.

I tried numerous times to use the Panasonic website's live chat support feature but kept getting a message that there were no employees on live chat at this time (no matter what time of day I tried). I then called their 1-888 support number and the first thing the automated message warned me was that I risked being charged a $9.99 service fee for help if I continued with the phone call and if my product turned out not to be covered under warranty. Given that I didn't know if the earphones were still covered under any limited warranty, I opted to just hang up at that point, write off my money spent, and order a second pair. They arrived on January 25, 2018, and again, I was satisfied. Less than two weeks later, while watching a homework video, the right earphone suddenly shorted out and stopped working.

I called Panasonic again figuring that this time it had to be covered under some warranty at less than 2 weeks old. The customer service rep sent me the e-mail instructions to submit my proof of purchase for both pairs and I later received an e-mail back with the instructions for shipping the headphones. They stated that I was only allowed to ship the product in one specific type of corrugated cardboard container, that it needed to be  certain size of that container, and that I would need to pay for tracking and insurance on the product on top of the shipping. The total amount for shipping cost more than THREE pairs of these headphones and they wouldn't guarantee that they would send me two new pairs to replace the two broken ones.

This is the worst experience I've ever had with a purchase from Amazon. I was disappointed and frustrated that I could not conduct my return directly through Amazon and have a replacement sent to me or my money refunded like is usually the case on Amazon, but instead had to do the whole runaround with Panasonic, and I still don't know whether Panasonic will honor its warranty and send me two new pairs. Based on the number of positive reviews for these earphones it seems like I did just get unlucky (twice) with defective pairs, however, if you're one of those unlucky ones you can count your money spent as lost based on the incredible hassle and lack of good customer service to make it right.

author: Husam Alrehaili
title: BE CAREFUL BEFORE YOU DEICED TO BUY THEIR PRODUCTS. ONE PRODUCT HAS DIFFERENT QUALITIES
content: They have two different qualities from the same product. I bought one at the beginning that I was totally satisfied with the quality. Around a month later, I ordered another one for my brother. It turned out the new one has a really cheap quality and it doesn't work and have so many issues.My brother noticed that even the call answering button was on the left cord, usually it is on the right cord. So I checked thePanasonic ErgoFit In-Ear Earbuds Headphones with Mic/Controller RP-TCM125-W (White) packaging and it turned out the packaging was different from the first one I got. Even the quality of the packaging was a cheap quality packaging. Also, same products have different barcode numbers and different model numbers. The cheap quality has an instruction paper that was in the packaging and most of it was written in Chinese. I'm totally disappointed since I felt that was clearly deception. I ordered a replacement for the one I got and I got another one with the same good quality. That's where I believe that they are cheating on customers.

author: CC
title: Panasonic earbuds
content: I don't know how hard it is to make earr buds but somehow Panasonic was unable to do it. They don't stay in your ear no matter what size bud you put on them. I have tried the Sony earbuds which have great sound quality but aren't comfortable. I guess I am stuck with the JVC earbuds that don't last long but until I find another pair I guess I'm stuck with them.

author: K.A.C.
title: Best. Ever. Earbuds.
content: You cannot beat these earbuds for the price!!! They work so well and last a long time. I've got weird ears that mean the typical earbud don't fit well in my ear and fall out. These don't. Sound is amazing, and they last a long time mine are nearly 2 years old. I've bought these for my father, sister, etc.  They're not entirely noise cancelling, but they do help me focus in a busy office or drown out other people on a long flight. Plus they've got fun colors!

author: jojo
title: Cheap but it works - the mic works well too (i use it for computer conference calls)
content:
I had purchased xiaomi headphones a like 4-5 years back which i thought were great for ~$30 and those were troopers despite my regular abuse! However, the dog finally got to them and chewed them up. Oops. Sadly, these days the xiaomi listings are rife and i worry about fake product. So, i opted for these cheap ones to take calls via my work laptop. I have a lot of conference calls so the most important for me was that the mic would be clear.

Well, these have worked great! The quality is real cheap. I miss the xiaomi like carbon fiber or whatever they were. These are just the cheap of the cheap wiring. But hey, it does the job and they stay in my ears. If I'm ever able to get some authentic xiaomi ones again, i'll be doing that as best bang for buck. But until then, this is an option that works.

author: Jason Kowing
title: comfortable fit, clean sound, unbeatable price!
content:
Looking for a good pair of buds to replace the Samsung pair that came with my S7, I needed something that wouldn't slide out easily like the Samsung pair does. These came up near the top of the list and, though I was a little skeptical with the idea that you get what you pay for, I figured I'd at least use them as a back up if they weren't the best product. I received these at my doorstep in two days' time and ripped open the packaging (may take a pair of scissors, it's packed very well) with the solid intention of beating them up a little.

The first thing I noticed was how much environmental sound they blocked out just by the fit alone. Straight in, the cups seal my eardrums from the outside world nicely, a plus in my book. They don't cancel the noise, but they do work as earplugs in a pinch. One of my "go-to" tester songs is Alabama 3's Woke Up This Morning. I actually had to turn down the volume on my MP3 player with these buds in my ears. The bass response was good (don't expect 8" subwoofer hits with an $8 pair of earbuds) and punched nicely, the overall midrange level was crisp. Next, I tried some Blues Traveler and the clean guitar sound came through beautifully. Having played it for a few hours almost non-stop while working, I can confidently say the fit is still as cushy and comfortable is it was the first minute.

For the price, you can't beat it. Even as a back up pair, drop everything you're doing and click the Buy button!

author: Matthew L. Laflamme
title: Great sound quality and blocks out background conversations in a variety of languages...
content:
I needed a new set of ear buds to use with my phone and iPod for use primarily while I was at work.  I work in IT in a busy, noisy environment and while I was intrigued by the noise cancelling ear buds, I was very put off by the price.  Initially, I chose these because of the price point and their high rating and I have to report that the price point belies the quality and performance of these ear buds.  I found that it is important as noted in another review to make sure that these fit snugly in your ears - then you will marvel at the quality of sound and their ability to block out background noise.  Listening to a live recording of Dave Brubeck, it was almost like I was at a concert of his.  The added benefit is that they also effectively blocked out nearby loud conversations in English, Hindi, Urdu and possibly Russian (or some other Slavic language).  With these babies in my ears, I can barely hear the guy in the next aisle who suffers from a chronic and untreated sinus condition.  All in all, I love them.

The only bad points I can possibly see - and time and use will tell - is that they seem a bit "delicate and small".  The buds that fit in your ear are well made but the part that attaches to the cords doesn't stick out of my ears and I worry when I have to gently tug the bud out of my ear by the cord.  As I use these more I'll find out how tough they are - they may very well stand up well.

All in all, these are a great product - fantastic sound if fitted properly (easy to do) and they effectively block out conversations and distractions in a variety of languages and dialects.  I give them two thumbs up and am buying a couple more pairs so I can have them on hand perchance I misplace this pair.  If you're on the fence, buy these.

author: Makena Kong
title: Should probably buy the warranty
content:
These used to last me half a year - but now they last me a couple of months. The last pair went dead in the left bud and my current pair went dead on the right bud. I have gone through at least 5 of these in the past 2 and a half years. They are getting worse and worse I swear. I should buy the warranty but I always forget. I think I should just invest in better earbuds. And not those airpods crap - there is no way people can not not lose them.

Is it me? Are earbuds only supposed to last a short amount of time? I used to swing my buds around like a lasso (a bad habit) but I stopped a while ago because they kept causing them to break. Now, I'm treat my earbuds so well, yet they still die on me. Are all the affordable earbuds just total garbage? I heard that Beats by Dr. Dre only cost $14 to make, yet are sold for like $200. So, earbuds must cost $0.50 to manufacture - so I feel so cheated when I spend more than $10 on a pair. If anyone has any affordable, quality earbud recommendations, please feel free to message me.

author: LC
title: Sounds ok, but it's not durable
content:
The sound and noise cancellation was ok, nothing to really write home about. Mic worked properly. The grip was alright, as far as not needing to worry about them falling out constantly, even with some moderate movement. However, the cord was so flimsy it got easily tangled.
Unfortunately, these earphones lasted less than a month before one of the buds stopped working. Also, when the earphones started to break down, it would also randomly pause and play the next song without pressing the controls. For the price, I was expecting better.
Quality is slightly better than a pair you would buy at a gas station, but lasts for about the same amount of time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: OMG, they don’t fall out! + comfy + great sound + economical
content:
I’ve never been a fan of earbuds because they usually always end up disappointing at some point. So far, these do not disappoint!

With almost all other earbuds, I find that If they start out fitting nicely and working well, something usually breaks down; the fit gets messed up, which either degrades the seal between the earbud and the ear and reduces the sound quality by a lot, or becomes physically uncomfortable. If not that. Not with these.

With other earbuds,  there may be moments where the fit and sound are excellent ...but then I cough, chew, smile, or do something totally normal, and at least one earbud slips out. Not with these.

The sound quality, most likely due to the excellent seal within the ear, is exceptional for something at this price range. clear, rich sound, with decent bass!

The weight is so slight, that I hardy feel them at all.

They’re also relatively comfortable to wear while laying down, meditating, side-sleeping, etc.

Soon as I experienced these earbuds, I bought a second set, and a set for my mom.

Excellent value!

author: Douglas E. Byers
title: Panasonic RPHJE120K In-Ear Headphone: Great once you learn how to wear them
content:
I've had a love/hate relationship with these earbuds until I learned how to properly use them (I've had them for a few weeks now). These are my first pair of in-ear earbuds and as many have already said, they are to be worn sealed into the ear canal to get the proper fidelity. You cannot simply fit them into the opening of the ear and get any bass response at all. I knew this but didn't know how you were supposed to get them inserted properly and I struggled in the absence of any pertinent guidance. I understand that everyone's ears are shaped a little differently but what I found that worked for me was to insert the bud into the opening of my ear canal and rotate it while applying inward pressure (kind of like turning a screw) until the cable/shaft points upwards (see my pic). When the bud is situated this way it slides into my ear canal and makes the appropriate seal and I can run the cable behind my ear. No amount of inward pressure could get the proper seal with the cables hanging downward like you would think it is intended.  It took me a while to figure this out. I also discovered that there is a fine line between pushing it in just enough to create the seal and pushing it in too far. Go too far and they begin to hurt rather quickly... and they hurt pretty bad. So find the spot where they seal but go no further. Again, it took me a while to figure this out. When positioned correctly I can wear them for extended periods.

That being said, once fitted correctly - sealed in the ear canal - these buds provide an adequate (quite a bit actually) amount of bass and sound isolation compared to the regular headphones that simply rest in front of the ear opening. The bass was too much at first. I realized I had my EQ settings on my device set to a high bass boost to compensate for my old headphones. Once adjusted to flatten out the bass they sounded fantastic.
